item.title: Liquid Wind 从 Uniper 和三星获得 4600 万美元，用于生产清洁燃料
item.description: 瑞典的 Liquid Wind AB 公司从 Uniper SE 和 Samsung Ventures 等公司筹集了 4400 万欧元（4600 万美元），用于其为航运业生产绿色燃料的计划。【原文：Sweden’s Liquid Wind AB raised €44 million ($46 million) from firms including Uniper SE and Samsung Ventures for its plan to produce green fuel for the shipping industry.】

item.title: 遭美联储反对的巴塞尔气候披露计划推迟至 2025 年实施
item.description: 巴塞尔银行监管委员会（Basel Committee on Banking Supervision）正在推迟银行披露气候风险的最后期限，此前美国联邦储备委员会（US Federal Reserve）的提议遭到了反对。【原文：The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision is pushing back a deadline for climate-risk disclosure by banks, following opposition against earlier proposals by the US Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 第二十九届缔约方会议："巧妙的会计方法
item.description: 晚上好，来自巴库。我们期待着缔约方大会主席国连夜提交一些大括号内的文件草案。我们将在早上为您带来更多关于主要融资协议、碳市场和减排工作的消息。与此同时，请访问彭博网站（Bloomberg.com），了解我们对 COP29 峰会的所有报道— 峰会全程免费—。【原文：Good evening from Baku. We’re expecting some heavily bracketed draft documents overnight from the COP presidency. We’ll bring you more on what’s been said on the main finance deal, carbon markets and mitigation work in the morning. Meanwhile, keep up with all of our COP29 coverage — which is free for the entire summit — on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 欧美力推石油资金限制协议，以战胜特朗普
item.description: 在美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普入主白宫前几周，欧盟、美国和其他国家正在敲定一项计划，为外国石油和天然气项目提供数百亿美元的资金支持。【原文：The EU, US and other countries are hammering out a plan to throttle tens of billions of dollars of financial support for foreign oil and gas projects, weeks before President-elect Donald Trump moves into the White House.】

item.title: COP29 峰会进入最后阶段，各国在财政问题上分歧巨大
item.description:
发展中国家表示，它们每年需要超过1万亿美元的气候融资。富裕国家则认为，其中绝大部分资金需要来自私营部门。【原文：

Developing countries say they need more than $1 trillion a year in climate finance. Rich nations argue the vast majority of this will need to come from the private sector. 

】

item.title: 拜登气候沙皇放弃绿色转型是 "经济渎职
item.description:
白宫国家气候顾问阿里-扎伊迪（Ali Zaidi ）在本周的《零点》节目中说："我认为《通货膨胀削减法》、《两党基础设施法》是火箭上的助推器。"但火箭就是私营部门。【原文：

“I think of the Inflation Reduction Act, the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, as the booster packs on a rocket,” White House National Climate Advisor Ali Zaidi says on this week’s episode of Zero. “But the rocket is the private sector.”

】

item.title: 埃克森签署向电池制造商 LG 化学供应锂的协议
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp. ）签署了一项初步协议，为 LG 化学有限公司在美国的一家工厂提供电池金属锂，从而加强了这家石油巨头在国内关键矿产供应链中的作用。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. has signed a preliminary agreement to provide battery metal lithium to an LG Chem Ltd. plant in the US, strengthening the oil major’s role in the domestic critical minerals supply chain.】

item.title: 大雪袭击英国和阿尔卑斯山，强风肆虐地中海
item.description: 冰雪天气引发了英国大部分地区的天气预警，北极冷空气提升了本周北欧地区的供暖需求。【原文：Snow and ice triggered weather warnings across much of the UK, as freezing Arctic air lifts heating demand across northern Europe this week.】

item.title: 国家集团在 COP29 会议上承诺不再有增无减地使用煤炭发电
item.description: 共有 25 个国家和欧盟承诺在其下一轮国家气候计划中不再新增有增无减的煤电，这是全球为遏制使用煤炭燃料而做出的最新承诺。【原文：A total of 25 countries and the European Union are pledging to commit to no new unabated coal power in their next round of national climate plans, the latest global pledge aimed at curbing use of the fuel.】

item.title: 印度煤炭发电厂将达不到污染目标，烟雾笼罩德里
item.description: 印度的大多数燃煤发电厂将再次无法达到主要的污染目标，从而加剧笼罩印度大部分地区的致命烟雾。【原文：Most of India’s coal-burning plants are set to again fall short of a major pollution target, adding to the deadly smog that’s enveloped large parts of the country.】

item.title: 建筑对地球有益吗？
item.description: 早上好，来自巴库。今天是 COP29 的 "城市化日"：建筑行业已成为温室气体的最大排放者。请继续阅读，了解为改变这一状况所做的努力。您也可以在 Bloomberg.com 上找到完整报道，我们对 COP29 的所有报道都是免费的。【原文：Good morning from Baku. It’s Urbanization Day at COP29, and there’s a good reason to focus on the subject: The buildings and the construction sector has become the largest emitter of greenhouse gases. Read on to learn more about the effort to change that. You can also find the full story on Bloomberg.com, where all of our COP29 coverage is free.】

item.title: 东京的酷暑引发公众对砍伐树木的愤怒
item.description:
一群老年居民守护着一排银杏树不被砍伐，他们是日本首都此类活动浪潮的一部分。【原文：

A group of elderly residents who guard a row of ginkgo trees from being cut down are part of a wave of such activism in the Japanese capital. 

】

item.title: 干旱持续，曼哈顿灌木丛大火阻塞交通
item.description: 周二下午，纽约一条主要高速公路上发生两起灌木丛火灾，消防员在救火时关闭了一个繁忙的出口，并封锁了车道。【原文：Firefighters closed a busy exit and blocked off lanes of traffic on a major New York highway as they responded to a two-alarm brush fire Tuesday afternoon.】

item.title: 为什么 "积极应对气候 "是绿色建筑的新目标？
item.description:
建筑师和开发商正在超越净零，设计他们希望对环境利大于弊的建筑。但要确定这是否属实却绝非易事。【原文：

Architects and developers are reaching beyond net zero, designing structures they hope do more good for the environment than bad. But determining whether that’s true is far from easy. 

】

item.title: 压力巨大的炸弹气旋将袭击加利福尼亚州和西海岸
item.description: 随着本季第一条大气河在北加州上岸，一股强大的炸弹气旋正以飓风的强度席卷西北太平洋地区，预计整个地区将出现暴雨、洪水和泥石流。【原文：A powerful bomb cyclone is ripping the Pacific Northwest with hurricane-strength winds as the season’s first atmospheric river comes ashore in Northern California, promising torrential rains, floods and mudslides across the region.】

item.title: COP29：谈判是 "粮食日 "的 "吃鸡 "游戏
item.description: 晚上好，来自巴库。我们听到了很多关于财政协议的可能数字。预计谈判代表今晚将工作到深夜，为周三的新草案做好准备。请继续阅读，并在 Bloomberg.com 上免费收看我们对 COP29 的所有报道。【原文：Good evening from Baku. We’re hearing lots of possible numbers for a finance deal being thrown around. Negotiators are expected to work late tonight, setting the stage for a new draft on Wednesday . Read on for more, and catch up with all of our COP29 coverage for free on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 顶级银行称西班牙山洪暴发将导致 2024 年 GDP 增长下降
item.description: 据西班牙储蓄银行（CaixaBank SA）称，西班牙最近发生的造成 200 多人死亡的洪灾将使今年的经济增长预期降低多达 20 个基点。【原文：Spain’s recent floods, which killed more than 200 people, will trim as much as 20 basis points off the expected economic growth this year, according to CaixaBank SA.】

item.title: 中国 CATL 就欧洲电动汽车电池回收问题进行早期谈判
item.description: 中国当代安培科技有限公司（Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.中国当代安培瑞斯科技有限公司正在洽谈在欧洲建立电池回收业务的事宜，随着该公司准备在匈牙利开始电池生产，其在该地区的业务范围将进一步扩大。【原文：China’s Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. is in talks to establish battery recycling operations in Europe, adding to its footprint in the region as the company prepares to start cell production in Hungary.】

item.title: 欧盟考虑修改碳边境税以帮助出口商
item.description: 一位负责监督这项措施的高级官员表示，在帮助欧盟出口商应对具有里程碑意义的碳边境税的副作用方面，欧盟将不遗余力。【原文：The European Union will leave nothing off the table when it comes to helping the bloc’s exporters deal with the side effects of a landmark carbon border levy, according to a senior official overseeing the measure.】

item.title: 纳米比亚力争筹集 4.5 亿美元以提高发电量
item.description: 纳米比亚国有电力公司计划通过在国内出售债券和筹集开发银行贷款来筹集 4.5 亿美元，以帮助这个非洲西南部国家提高发电量。【原文：Namibia’s state-owned electricity utility plans to raise $450 million by selling bonds in the country and raising development bank loans to help the southwest African nation boost power generation.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，廉价电动汽车租赁的时间正在流逝
item.description:
随着联邦税收抵免即将发生变化，现在可能是购买电动汽车的最佳时机。【原文：

With changes to federal tax credits on the horizon, now might be the best time to get a good deal on an electric car. 

】

item.title: 尽管本周有雨，纽约 22 年来最严重的干旱仍将持续
item.description: 纽约市和东北部本周终于将迎来一些明显的降雨，但这并不足以打破困扰该地区数月之久的干旱。【原文：New York City and the Northeast will finally get some measurable rain this week, but it won’t be enough to break the drought that has gripped the region for months.】

item.title: 全球最大有线电视公司之一的首席执行官表示，英国应尽快订购，否则将错失良机
item.description: 英国已经没有时间来确保其所需的电力电缆，以实现其在本十年结束前建立脱碳电网的目标。【原文：The UK is running out of time to secure the power cables it needs to reach its goal for a decarbonized power grid by the end of the decade.】

item.title: 欧洲央行埃尔德森警告自然退化带来通胀风险
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员弗兰克-埃尔德森（Frank Elderson）表示，欧洲中央银行必须考虑到自然破坏所带来的风险，这一过程可能会像气候变化一样引发通货膨胀。【原文：The European Central Bank must account for risks stemming from damage to nature, a process that could feed inflation in the same way that climate change does, according to Executive Board member Frank Elderson.】

item.title: 冰冻气温本周席卷欧洲，大雪袭击英国
item.description: 随着一股北极气流带来今冬首场寒流，欧洲部分地区白雪皑皑，加剧了整个地区的供暖需求。【原文：Snow is blanketing parts of Europe as a blast of Arctic air brings the first cold snap of winter, boosting heating demand across the region.】

item.title: 340 亿美元资产管理公司计划在新加坡招聘气候融资人员
item.description: Mirova SA 管理着价值约 319 亿欧元（340 亿美元）的资产，计划在亚洲扩张，以利用该地区日益增长的能源转型相关投资。【原文：Mirova SA, which manages assets worth about €31.9 billion ($34 billion), plans to expand in Asia to tap the region’s growing pool of energy transition-related investments.】

item.title: 菲律宾恢复处理新的绿色能源项目
item.description: 菲律宾将于本月开始接受和处理可再生能源合同，此前，由于大量申请，政府重新调整了规则，可再生能源合同暂停了五个月。【原文：The Philippines will start to accept and process renewable energy contracts this month after a five-month pause as the government rejigged rules amid a slew of applications.】

item.title: 特朗普迫使哥伦比亚就 400 亿美元气候计划与中国谈判
item.description: 哥伦比亚正在抓紧时间与美国达成协议，以便在唐纳德-特朗普上任前为一项 400 亿美元的气候投资计划发放第一批现金。如果这一努力失败，那么中国可能是一个选择。【原文：Colombia is hurrying to land a deal with the US that would unlock the first tranches of cash for a $40 billion climate investment plan before Donald Trump takes office. If that push fails, then China could be an option.】

item.title: 斯坦查特称债务折扣使非洲成为自然债务转换的理想之地
item.description: 据一位帮助完成首次债务换自然交易的银行家说，许多非洲国家的债务交易折价率很高，这使非洲大陆成为债务换自然交易的首选之地。【原文：The deep discount at which many African countries’ debt trades makes the continent a prime location for debt-for-nature swaps, according to a banker who helped conclude the first execution of the instruments.】

item.title: 气候融资让农民失望
item.description: 早上好，来自巴库。今天是COP29的粮食日，但联合国气候谈判在解决全球变暖对农业影响的方案方面却乏善可陈。请继续阅读，或在彭博社网站（Bloomberg.com）上查找相关报道，我们对 COP29 的所有报道都是免费的。【原文：Good morning from Baku. It’s Food Day at COP29, but UN climate talks have offered slim pickings when it comes to solutions for addressing the impacts of global warming of agriculture. Read on, or find the story on Bloomberg.com, where all of our COP29 coverage is free.】
